Tomorrowland

Airing the last Friday of each month, "Euphoria" features a mix of "fresh new releases and classic anthems, diving into the music that Hardwell loves."

  • Home
  • NEWS

Hardwell has unveiled his very own radio show, Euphoria, which will air monthly on "One World Radio," the official radio station and content platform of Tomorrowland.

With a title that’s as fitting as his timeless dance anthems, the show promises to be an unmissable treat for EDM fans around the world. For Hardwell, who in 2022 made a triumphant return to the festival circuit after a multi-year hiatus, Euphoria is another impactful move to connect with his global audience.

Blending fresh new releases with electronic classics, the show is designed to be a high-flying journey into the music that fuels Hardwell's world. Over the course of an hour, fans of the iconic DJ and producer can expect his signature style, a pulse-pounding fusion of progressive and big room house with tinctures of techno.

Euphoria will air the last Friday of every month. The show, according to Tomorrowland, features "a mix of fresh new releases and classic anthems, diving into the music that Hardwell loves."

The debut of Euphoria coincides with the reveal of Tomorrowland's 2025 lineup. Hardwell will perform at the storied Belgium festival along with Martin Garrix, Eric Prydz, David Guetta, Armin van Buuren and Swedish House Mafia, among over 600 others.
